VD_vulde module

class VD_vulde.InputFeatures(input_tokens, input_ids, idx, label)[source]

Bases: object

Train the model incrementally with additional dataset samples.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing model configuration.

  • train_dataset (TextDataset) – Dataset for training.

  • model (object) – Model to be trained.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for data processing.

Returns:

Best accuracy achieved during training.

Return type:

class VD_vulde.TextDataset(tokenizer, args, file_path=None, one_hot_vectors=[], suffixes=[])[source]

Bases: Dataset

Dataset for loading and processing textual data for training or evaluation.

Parameters:

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for processing text data.

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Arguments including configurations for processing the dataset.

  • file_path (str) – Path to the dataset file.

  • one_hot_vectors (list) – List of one-hot encoded vectors for labels.

  • suffixes (list) – List of suffixes for label categorization.

VD_vulde.codebert_deploy(model_pre, config, tokenizer, args)[source]

Deploys the model with incremental learning on a specified training dataset.

Parameters:

  • model_pre (object) – Pre-trained model instance to be used as the base model.

  • config (object) – Configuration of the model, including hyperparameters.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance to process the dataset.

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser with configurations for deployment, such as file paths, batch sizes, and device setup.

Return type:

None

VD_vulde.codebert_train(model_pre, config, tokenizer, args)[source]

Trains the model on a specified training dataset using provided configurations and tokenizer.

Parameters:

  • model_pre (object) – Pre-trained model instance to be used as the base model.

  • config (object) – Configuration of the model, including hyperparameters.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance to process the dataset.

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser with configurations for training, such as file paths, batch sizes, and device setup.

Return type:

None

VD_vulde.conformal_prediction(args, model, tokenizer)[source]

Perform conformal prediction for uncertainty quantification.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing configuration.

  • model (object) – Model for prediction.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for data processing.

Returns:

Contains result dictionary and list of selected indices.

Return type:

tuple

VD_vulde.cvconvert_examples_to_features(code_new, label, tokenizer, args)[source]

Convert input text and label into features using a tokenizer.

Parameters:

  • code_new (str) – The input code to be tokenized.

  • label (list) – The label corresponding to the input code.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance to tokenize the input code.

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Arguments including block size and other configurations.

Returns:

Features containing tokenized data, token IDs, and labels.

Return type:

InputFeatures

VD_vulde.deploy(args, train_dataset, model, tokenizer)[source]

Deploy the model for training with an incremental learning approach.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing model configuration.

  • train_dataset (TextDataset) – Dataset for training.

  • model (object) – Model to be trained.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for data processing.

Returns:

Best accuracy achieved during deployment.

Return type:

float

VD_vulde.epoch_test(args, model, tokenizer)[source]

Evaluates the model performance on a test dataset for each epoch.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing evaluation configuration, such as file paths, batch sizes, and device setup.

  • model (object) – The model to be evaluated.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance used to process the dataset.

Returns:

A dictionary containing evaluation metrics: - “test_acc” : float : Accuracy of the model on the test dataset. - “test_rec” : float : Recall of the model on the test dataset. - “test_f1” : float : F1 score of the model on the test dataset.

Return type:

dict

VD_vulde.evaluate(args, model, tokenizer, eval_when_training=False)[source]

Evaluate the model performance on the validation dataset.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing evaluation configuration.

  • model (object) – Model to be evaluated.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for data processing.

  • eval_when_training (bool) – Flag indicating if evaluation should happen during training.

Returns:

Dictionary containing evaluation metrics.

Return type:

dict

VD_vulde.evaluate_test(args, model, tokenizer, eval_when_training=False)[source]

Evaluate the model performance on a test dataset.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing evaluation configuration, including output directory, batch sizes, device, and other model parameters.

  • model (object) – The model to be evaluated, such as a neural network model.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance used for data processing.

  • eval_when_training (bool, optional) – If True, evaluation will happen during training. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A dictionary containing evaluation metrics: - “test_loss” : float : Perplexity computed from evaluation loss. - “test_acc” : float : Accuracy of the model on the test dataset.

Return type:

dict

VD_vulde.incre(args, train_dataset, model, tokenizer)[source]

Train the model incrementally with additional dataset samples.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing model configuration.

  • train_dataset (TextDataset) – Dataset for training.

  • model (object) – Model to be trained.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for data processing.

Returns:

Best accuracy achieved during training.

Return type:

float

VD_vulde.model_initial()[source]

Initializes model parameters, configurations, and tokenizer.

Uses hyperparameters from nni for tuning if available, otherwise defaults to specified parameters.

Returns:

  • model : object : The initialized model.

  • config : object : Model configuration.

  • tokenizer : object : Tokenizer instance.

  • args : argparse.Namespace : Argument parser with model configuration.

Return type:

tuple

VD_vulde.onehot(file_path='', seed=123)[source]

Generate one-hot encoded vectors for categorical labels.

Parameters:

  • file_path (str) – Path to the dataset file containing label information.

  • seed (int) – Random seed for reproducibility.

Returns:

A tuple containing one-hot encoded vectors and list of suffixes.

Return type:

tuple

VD_vulde.remove_duplicates_and_preserve_order(arr)[source]

Remove duplicate elements from a list while preserving the order.

Parameters:

arr (list) – List from which duplicates need to be removed.

Returns:

List with duplicates removed, preserving the original order.

Return type:

list

VD_vulde.set_seed(seed=42)[source]

Set the random seed for reproducibility across NumPy, PyTorch, and Python.

Parameters:

seed (int) – The random seed for reproducibility.

VD_vulde.train(args, train_dataset, model, tokenizer)[source]

Train the model on the training dataset.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing model configuration.

  • train_dataset (TextDataset) – Dataset for training.

  • model (object) – Model to be trained.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for data processing.

Returns:

Best F1 score achieved during training.

Return type:

float
